nodes.text: Voth Vassakka was a soldier of the Galactic Republic who held the Republic's supply schedule for the contested world of Corellia during the battle waged by the reconstituted Sith Empire there.
At Coronet City's government district, Vassakka was lured out and killed by forces of the Empire for the schedule, though not before giving a solo-last stand.

A male Human who served as a soldier of the Galactic Republic by the time of the Galactic War fought against the reconstituted Sith Empire, Voth Vassakka held the Republic's supply schedule on the contested world of Corellia during the Republic-Empire battle there in 3640 BBY.
The schedule was deemed to be a crucial piece of military intelligence on Corellia, and was as such considered by the Empire to be of substantial value.

Thus, during an effort to break the lines of the Republic military and cripple their deployment efforts on Corellia's government district in the planetary capital Coronet City, an Imperial operating under Admiral Hestun led assaults on enemy anti-aircraft personnel, field communication units, and anti-aircaft overseers, before proceeding to slice into a Republic console at Voth Vassakka's position.

Provoked by this intrusion, the soldier took upon himself to retaliate against the Imperial operative, though this was his demise; descending to ground-level with a jetpack for a solo-last stand, Vassakka proved to be no match for the assailant and was killed. The Republic trooper's supply schedule—the true prize of the operation—was subsequently taken to the nearby Imperial Central Command, where it was given to the Corellians' invaders.

As a Republic trooper, Voth Vassakka sported blue markings and brown accents on his standard white-colored armor and a pauldron piece fixed atop his left shoulder, whilst the right shoulder-pad was adorned with the emblem of the Republic. Wearing a bandolier and a jetpack, the soldier was armed with an assault cannon, in addition to a rail gun and cryo grenades.

Voth Vassakka's first and only appearance is in the 2011 video game Star Wars: The Old Republic. There, he could only be spawned on Corellia as an enemy non-player character target during the final stage of "Break the Lines," a bonus mission of the Imperial quest "Precision Strikes."
